div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, Vs Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, Respondents. No. R e p l y .
Comes now the Petitioner herein and replying to the answer of the respondents herein, replies as follows:

Said Petitioner denies that by any reason of the writ of habeas corpus in Number 41787, or of any proceedings, or of any adjudica- tion of the Superior Court of the County of King, State of Washington, or of any Judges thereof, referred to in the answer of respondents, or by reason of any thingtherein, or any proceedings between the parties hereot, or any other persons or parties, he is estopped from further questioning any right or rights claimed by said respondents, or either of them, as to the custody of said child, Alice B. Clifford.
And in further reply said Petitioner avers and alleges:

That upon the hearing of said proceeding in said Superior Court and before the Honorable Boyd J. Tallman, the Judge before whom said hearing of said habeas corpus proceeding was had, said Petitioner presented and put in evidence a copy of the judicial records and proceedings of the Superior Court of the City and in the notion granting the divorce referred to in his petition herein County of San Francisco, State of California, authentioated a provided i Section 905 of the Revised Statutes of the United States, and claimed the right to the custody of said child upon the ground that is was being imprisoned and detained by respondents, and each of them, in violation of Article exemplified and IV, Section 1 of the United States and Section 905 of the Revised Statutes of the United States, and demanded that in pursuance of said provision of said Constitution and said provision of said Revised Statutes if the United States, full faith and credit to said records of said Superior Court of California should be given by said Court of Washington and the respondents herein, and that said child should be released from the imprisionment and detention by said respondents, and each of them, and delivered into the custody of your Petitioner, to be by him taken back to the juris- diction of said Court of California; but said Superior Court of Washington refused, and it appears upon the face of the records and proceedings of said Superior Court of Washington, in said habeas corpus proceedings therein, that said Court refused, to give any faith or credit to the records or proceedings of the said Court of California; and your Petitioner sets up and claims under said Article IV, Section 1, of the Constitution of the United States, and said Section 905 of the Revised Statutes of the United States, that said record and proceedings of said Superior Court of Wash- ington in the application therein for a writ of habeas corpus should be disregarded by this Court and held to be of no force or effect whatever.

Further replying to the answer of the respondents herein, as to the adoption of said child by proceedings in Number 5262 of said Superior Court of the State of Washington, said Petitioner avers and alleges that by reason of the facts set out in his petition herein, said child at the time said adoption proceedings were commended and had, and ever since, has been, a resident of and at all of said time had and yet has her domicile in the State of California, and that the facts of such residence and domicile and her being a ward of said Superior Court of California and subject to the control and jurisdiction thereof, were made to appear before the said Superior Court of Washington when said proceedings for the adoption of said child were taken and had therein, and said domicile and said wardship of said child appear upon the face of the records and proceedings of said Superior Court of said State of Washington in the matter of the adoption of said child, which consist of a petition by the respondents herein to be allowed to adopt said child, a copy of which is hereto attached marked "Exhibit A" and made a part hereof, a written consent to the adoption of said child, a copt of which is hereto attached, marked "Exhibit B" and made a part hereof, and an order for the adoption of said child, a copy of which is attached to the answer of the respondents herein marked "Exhibit E", and which is hereby referred to and made a part hereof, and of them alone; but nevertheless the said Court of Washington refused to give any faith or credit to the said records or proceedings of said Court of California, and made and entered said order allowing said adoption of said child; and your Petitioner hereby sets up and claims that under said Article IV, Section 1 of the Constitution of the United States and Section 905 of the Revised Statutes thereof, said order allowing said adoption is void, and of no force or effect.

And further replying as to the now pending in the Superior Court of the State of Washington in and for the County of King to set aside said order of adoption, said Petitioner alleges that said proceeding is nothing more than to have expunged from the records of that Court an order claimed by said Petitioner to be void and of no affect, and presents to reason why this appli- cation should be denied, abated or continued

And further replying to Exhibit C of respondents' answer, reffered to and adopted by them as a portion of their answer herein, said petitioner denies, as alleged in Parahraph IX thereof, that no notice whatever was served upon them, or either of them, or that they, or either of them, received no information as to the change of the decree of the Court of California as to this custody of said child; and on the contrary alleges that eight days' notice of the motion to modify the decree was given and served upon William P. Humphreys. Esq., who was and yet is the attorney of record for Grace E. Williams in the action wherein said decree was made and entered.

Futher replying to Paragraoh I of the affirmative defense of respondents' Exhibit C adopted as a portion of their answer herein, said Petitioner alleges and avers that all of thematters and things therein set up and alleged were set upp ad alleged in the complaints in actions brought by Grace E. Williams, as Grace E. Clifford, against your Petitioner in the said Court of California, wherein your Petitioner was granted a divore from her, and all of such matters and things were adjudged and decreed by said Court against her and in favor of your Petitioner, and are barred by the judgments therein, one which is the judgment granting said divorce; and further replying as to the matters and things set out in said paragraph, said Petitioner avers and alleges that they are beyond the jurisdiction of this Court upon this application, and are solely and exclusively within the jurisdiction of said Superior Court of California.

WHEREFORE, Petitioner objects to the consideration by this Court of any of the matters or things set out in this answer of the respondents herein, and respondents are notified hereby that upon the calling of this matter for hearing herein Petitioner will move the Court for judgment upon the pleadings herein, and for the granting of the prayer of his Petition herein; and in the case of the Court's refusal to grant said motion Petitioner will then offer evidence in support of his Petition herein, and of this Reply. W H White J. J. Burt Attorneys for Petitioner.
State of Washington, ) County of King. ) ss.

J. J. Burt, being duly sworn, says; That he is one of the attorneys for the Petitioner in the above entitled matter or proceeding; that he has read the foregoing reply of the Petitioner therein and knows the contents thereof, and that he verily believes the same to be true.

Deponent further says that the reason he makes this affidavit is that said Petitioner is absent from the State of Washington, and in the State of California, and also that deponent is better in- formed as to the facts stated in said reply than is the said Petitioner.
J J Burt
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 15th day of June, A. D. 1904.
William B Allison Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
Exhibit A
IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON, FOR KING COUNTY.
In the Matter of the Adoption of Alice B. Clifford, an infant, by Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, his wife,
No. Petition.
To the Hon. Boyd J. Tallman, one of the Judges of the above entitled court:
The petition of Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, his wife, respectfully shows;
1. That petitioners Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams are and ever since the 15th day of August, 1903, have been husband and wife, and are residents of Seattle, King County, Washington.
a. That your petitioners desire to adopt as their own an infant female child named Alice B. Clifford, and to change the name of said child to Alice B. Williams.

3. That the parents of said child, Peter A. Clifford and his then wife, Grace E. Williams, were divorced by decree of the Superior Court of San Francisco County, California, on the 20th day of May, 1908, and that said decree by its terms awarded the carem custody and control of said infant to its mother Grace E. Clifford, now Grace E. Williams.

4. That said Peter A. Clifford and his then wife, Grace E. Clifford, have ever since the issuanceof said decree, and for a long time prior thereto, lived separate and apart, during all of which time said infant, Alice B. Clifford, has been and now is in the care, custody and control of its said mother, Grace E. Williams.
5. That said Grace E. Williams and said infant, Alice B. Clifford are residents of King County, Washington.

6. That your petitioners are persons of good oral characterm industrious habits, and good prospects in life, of the ages of 31 years and 32 years respectively, are amply able to provide a suitable home for said child, and are in every respect fit and proper persons to be entrusted with the moral ad other character of said child, and to make a reasonable provision for its future usefulness and happiness in life.

WHEREFORE, your petitioners pray that by order of this court said infant, Alice B. Clifford, shall from and after the date of such order be deemed to all legal intent are purposes the child of your petitioners, Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, and that said child be rendered capable of inheriting the estate of your petitioners and each of them, and that the name of said child be changed to Alice B. Williams.
Herbert O. Williams Grace E. Williams
Sweeney and Steiner, Attorneys for petitioners.
State of Washington County of King.

Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams being first duly sworn on oath say, each for himself, that they are the peti- tioners above named, and that they have read the foregoing petition, know the contents thereof, and that the same is true.
Herbert O. Williams Grace E. Williams
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 18th day of Nov. 1903. G. E. Steiner, Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
Exhibit B
In the Matter of the Adoption of Alice B. Clifford, an infant, by Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, his wife,
No. Consent to Adoption.
State of Washington County of King.

I, Grace E. Willia,s being first duly sworn say: That I am the mother of Alice B. Clifford, the infant child mentioned in foregoing petition of Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, his wife; that I was divorced from Peter A. Clifford, the father of said child, in San Francisco County, California, on or about the 20th day of May, 1902, and that the court in granting the divorce awarded the care, custody and control of said child; that I hereby consent to the adoption of said child, Alice B. Clifford, by Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, the foregoing petitioners, and that the name of said child be changed to Alice B. Williams.
Grace E. Williams
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 12th day of Nov. 1903. G. E. Steiner Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
ORIGINAL. No. 1204 Tx
In the United States C I R C U I T Court FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN Division
Peter A. Clifford, Petitioner, vs. Herbert O. Williams and Grace E. Williams, Respondents.
R E P L Y .
FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, DIST. of WASHINGTON. JUN 15 1904 A. REEVES AYRES Clerk HM Matthew Deputy W. H. White and J. J. Burt, Attorneys for Petitioner
